name: Basics
title: Basic elements
text:
- 44100.0 is the sample rate of the audio. Therefore, it must not be changed;
- "i" or "x" is the value of the for/variable;

name: ChoiceBox
title: ChoiceBox
text:
Select the type Formula or Java Code from the ChoiceBox:
- "Formula": to insert the (Java) formula.
- "Java Code": to insert an if-then-else Java code.

name: Formula
title: TextField formula
text:
The formula may look like
- "y = Math.sin(440 * a);"
or just
- "Math.sin(440 * a);".

name: Java Code
title: TextArea formula

name: Condition angle
title: Condition angle
text:
A formula for the sinusoidal waveform for 440Hz is

"y = Math.sin(2.0 * Math.PI * x * (440 / 44100.0))"

where 2 * PI * x is the sinusoidal code, and the text within the parentheses determines the frequency of a 44100Hz audio sample (you cannot change it, so don't do it).

The content inside the parentheses can also be written as "Math.sin(440 * a)".

title: TextArea uncommon formula

name: Another Formula
title: Another formula
text:
The mathematical formula of a quadratic wave is
"y = Math.signum(Math.sin(440 * a));".
